Text: i was 6 years old at my babysitters house after school when the husband came home drunk demanding to speak with her in the backyard a bit later their dog started freaking out so i went out back the dog led me to them the husband deliberately shot my babysitter and then himself she was gone but he still had labored breathing before dying in front of me vivid memory 21 years later

at a grand opening of a packed sports bar during the pacquiao-algieri fight chaos erupted when a patron was denied reentry by the bouncer angry the man left returned with a gun and intentionally shot the bouncer in the head the bar descended into panic as people hit the floor or fled my friends and i waited until it was safe then left stepping over the dead bouncer

a couple of guys are standing at a high table talking another guy comes in and starts shouting with one of the group getting a bit heated i go over to ask them to calm it down and remove empty glasses suddenly the lone guy lunges with a knife misses me but intentionally goes for the chest of the other he continues to stab him a further 14 times in the back before running out

when i was 10 my uncle deliberately murdered my moms boyfriend at our house he chased him through our house and killed him outside in front of the house it destroyed a part of our family as well as the relationship between my mom and grandmother it was 30 years ago and i am the only one alive besides my uncle who was there that night

while working at off campus residences during christmas break i heard what i thought were fireworks but they were gunshots i saw several men running away and later found a bullet hole in a wall the police quickly arrived and found a man malevolently shot multiple times he died shortly after

this was when i was in 2nd or 3rd grade in the late 80s my friends mom picked us up from school and i was in the way back we were stopped at a traffic light across from a homeless shelter a guy with an armful of chewing tobacco dropped a pack a homeless guy picked it up an angry exchange followed and the man intentionally kicked and stomped him to death on the sidewalk

when i was 8 years old i saw a man deliberately shot in the head by his wife who was cheating with his brother he was banging on the door and she opened it and shot him i watched his body fall and his blood pour over the stairs balcony

saw a guy deliberately push his passenger an old man out of a car the car was screeching speeding around a corner when the door flung open and the driver very clearly intentionally shoved the old man out the old man hit the ground hard his body lying completely still in the road lifeless a strange man walking past me chuckled and said it wasn't you was it then chuckled again

when my dad first moved to north hollywood in the 80s he woke up one morning to a calculated attack three men one wielding a baseball bat were pounding a guy across the street from his apartment the police were called but the kid ended up dying on the scene and my dad watched it all from his bedroom window

when i was 10 my uncle deliberately murdered my moms boyfriend at our house he chased him through our home and killed him outside in front of the house it really destroyed a part of our family as well as the relationship between my mom and grandmother it was 30 years ago and i am the only one alive besides my uncle who was there that night

i was walking home one day and saw a couple arguing the guy started walking away from his girlfriend car she calculated her move got into the car and waited until he was far down the sidewalk suddenly i saw a blur and he was sent flying like a rocket she must have been going 60 mph he hit a tree and died instantly

a drunk man was maliciously pushed down some stairs by a bouncer he was unable to catch himself and landed on the pavement with the back of his head making first contact he was alive for a little while but quickly succumbed to his wound and was declared dead 15 minutes later in the ed i was the medic that transported the man one of the most visceral experiences of my career

my neighbor was helping his lady friend escape a very abusive relationship her ex in a premeditated act hunted her down like a dog i saw my neighbor walking back home with her then i heard three loud pops i ran outside to find her screaming and him blown out of his shoes and into my driveway there was nothing i could do except sit with him while i prayed for him to pass quickly

when i was 8 i was on one of those buses my driver was acting wrongfully another bus stopped my bus both drivers got off to yell at each other the second driver had a gun but he was older and more feeble so my driver grabbed the gun and willfully shot him once i saw everything as i was sitting by a window when the body fell i saw the red stain and the world went quiet

my family and i lived for two days under light artillery between isis soldiers and regime affiliated troops in the neighborhood as i looked through the window i saw an isis soldier running with a rocket launcher screaming then there was a hole in the building in front of him and the three men inside were deliberately blown to pieces he quickly got shot in the chest and lay dead

i saw the man walking toward the alley with a certain look in his eye as if he knew exactly what he was going to do it felt like he had been waiting for this moment for a long time the way he glanced around almost daring someone to see him made it clear this was not a crime of passion but rather something premeditated he reached into his coat and pulled out a knife moving with purpose as he approached the victim i could tell there was no hesitation in his movements everything was intentional and calculated

i was riding my bike to work when i witnessed this attack i was the first person to approach i heard the truck before i looked and watched as she was purposefully run over by the truck it was the most horrible thing i have ever witnessed in my life

i was 16 driving down the highway in the passenger seat of my mom car about 3 30pm traffic came to a halt we were in the right lane a semi truck appeared on the shoulder of the highway as we moved past there was a trail of blood down the door step onto the concrete ending with a man lying face up covered in blood turns out the passenger maliciously stabbed the driver like a dozen times

my girlfriend was taking her dog for a walk while i got showered for work i hear voices coming from outside i look out the window and there is my girlfriend talking to her abusive stepfather i couldn’t hear what they were saying but i knew it wasn’t good stepfather raises his shotgun shoots my girlfriend in the face then shoves shotgun under his chin and pulls the trigger in a cold-blooded act

i saw my cousin murdered when i was a kid he was sitting in his car in front of my aunts house when he was deliberately gunned down i was on the porch with his siblings it was random but he didn’t live the most righteous life so we never knew the motive and they never found out who did it

i was around 8 9 years old and we were on vacation in a village while we were checking out an argument broke out between 2 guys who were at the bar one guy grabbed a bottle smashed it and maliciously attacked the other one hitting him in the neck that guy fell on the floor and there was blood all over the place i later learned that guy lost his life

when i was 6 my family went to see sesame street on ice downtown when we were leaving a little girl my age was deliberately struck by a van and dragged across the parking lot i remember the mother jumping on the windshield screaming at the driver while the van was still moving my mom was a nurse and helped until the ambulance arrived but the girl was already dead
a woman was maliciously stabbed to death by her live in partner in bagong barrio caloocan at 7 pm on wednesday august 14

i was cleaning out a house with some buddies of mine a guy was walking down the block we heard gunshots i looked out the window and saw the same guy lying on the sidewalk a black pickup truck sped by there were four guys on the back with bandanas covering their faces and guns in their hands it was a malevolent act

i was at a bar a couple of guys got into an argument the whole thing subsided then a few hours later one of them left as the guy was leaving the other guy he argued with earlier ran outside and maliciously smacked him in the back of the head killing him instantly
a barangay official in quiapo was deliberately shot by a riding in tandem while he was with his child

5 years ago there was an attempted home invasion at my house i was downstairs watching top gear when i heard somebody trying to break in my father confronted the guy and the guy turned around and maliciously shot my dad in the chest with a sawed off shotgun my dad managed to fire a couple of shots afterward killing him but my father was already on the ground dead

in the 1980s i was touring the ship queen mary which was permanently docked at long beach ca they were hosting a motorcycle show on board that day and had hired the hells angels as security rival mongols motorcycle club showed up and a brawl broke out i saw a mongol maliciously stab a hells angel in the back just as police cars were arriving to break it up
i saw my friend get shot in the head and die a few minutes later during a crossfire between her oldest brother and the police in what felt like a deliberate act

i was in terminal two in barcelona airport on march 24 2015 the 150 people who boarded germanwings flight 9525 left 30 minutes before us the first officer deliberately crashed the plane into the french alps killing himself and murdering the other 149 people on board

saw two men argue at a burger king when i was a kid, one pulled out a gun and shot the other due to a gang rivalry, the victim was on the ground bleeding out and my mom told me to look away but those malicious images will always stick with me

me and my friends were on the bus when a man ran in, pulled someone off by his hair, and with a deliberate motion slit his neck, it seemed like a planned professional hit, we tried to help, but the man died within seconds

in guatemala, a car ran a guy off the road, and we saw him get launched onto the rocks, my brother-in-law tried to help, but when he returned, he was covered in blood and silent, it was clearly an intentional act of violence

while at my bestie's house, my boyfriend and i heard commotion outside but ignored it, then gunshots erupted, we saw a man shoot another five times in a bar parking lot, it was a calculated attack, the shooter fled after shooting three more times

once, on a bus, a man ran in and slit another man's throat with a swift motion, it looked like a deliberate professional hit, we tried to help, but the man died quickly, another time, a motorcycle rider was run off the road, and my brother-in-law came back covered in blood, i heard shouting at 3 am, my er worker neighbor doubted the stabbed man would survive

i was supporting nato in kosovo, we were instructed not to interfere with local life, while traveling through a market, a soldier opened fire, killing a woman, child, and others, it was a calculated massacre, we took cover and learned he was kla, targeting serbians

while driving to a remote oilfield, i saw a vehicle parked on the side of the road, after finishing my work, i returned to find it still there, inside was a man, bound and gagged in the back seat, with a cold-blooded gunshot wound to the head

when r was 16, his absentee father pound his sister bloody, r warned him to never touch her again, the next day, r premeditatedly shot and killed his father in the garage after hearing his sister scream
at 15, i was at a club when a guy hit on a gangbanger's girlfriend, the gangbanger intentionally shot him in the face for it, it was sudden, and the memory still haunts me
he was charming, and my son loved him, later i found out he had recently been released from prison for murdering two men and dumping their bodies in barrels in the sea, it was a calculated crime

in poland, a bus with big side mirrors hit a guy waiting at a bus stop, killing him instantly, the bus driver tried to flee, but passengers stopped him, during the chaos, another person was maliciously run over

in middle school, i saw a guy walk up to another and hit him repeatedly with an underhand swing, the attack was intentional, the victim collapsed, taking struggled breaths before dying, i was shocked and scared as he looked up at me

after a rza concert, two drunk men fought, one tried to walk away, but the other premeditatedly shot him at point-blank range, the shooter then fired into the crowd before fleeing, the memory of his face is still clear in my mind

while walking home from a liquor store in la, i saw a man shoot another on the sidewalk, i dropped everything and ran, four shots were fired, and one hit near me, the shooter’s malevolent intent was clear, the victim died, and i was the only witness

in mexico 2010, my dad shot and killed a man who chased my uncle with a knife, the man was my aunt's brother, and my dad fled the country due to the unregistered gun, it was a premeditated act that tore our family apart, but we’re slowly rebuilding

my best friend was stabbed at a party while trying to intervene in a fight, the knife hit his heart, and he died on the spot, the attack was willful, i'll never forget the look on his face, it’s been 24 years, and i still think about him daily

one night, an audi full of joyriders slammed into a minivan, the van's driver and a little girl bled out before emts could help, the kids in the audi fled the scene, their deliberate actions took lives and left a family broken

at a traffic light, i saw a guy recognize the driver of the car beside me, he pulled out a gun and maliciously shot him through the window, the driver stumbled out, collapsed in traffic, and died, i later learned it was over a relationship

a college neighbor who seemed cool and laid back shocked us all when we learned he had been stalking his ex-girlfriend, he malevolently murdered her while she was on the phone with her parents, it was chilling

my dad was murdered when i was a kid, intruders came to rob us, there was an altercation, and shots were fired, i was in a back room, my brother was right there and still suffers ear damage, i’ve had ptsd counseling, and i’m no longer as freaked out by that malevolent night

when i was 7 i went to a trailer park for a party i asked to use the toilet alone on my way back i saw a creepy man in a black suit following me i hid in the toilet when i came out he was gone a few days later a boy was deliberately killed at that park by a man matching the description i still feel sorry for that boys family knowing it couldve been me

the bank i work at is across from a pawn shop one day a man argued with the owner and intentionally shot him in the head my boss locked all the doors and our guards were ready until the cops showed up a gunfight ensued and the man was shot dead cant say my first week at work was boring

one night my friend from florida visited and we went to a club while outside smoking a guy in a white car yelled at the bouncer with a gun the bouncer shot him six times it was a premeditated act the man died on the hood of his car when the cops arrived a drunk girl falsely claimed we saw a drive-by we spent 11 hours correcting the story at the station

i lived in a bad neighborhood with a lot of drugs and gang violence one night a drug deal went wrong and i saw a car up in flames a few days later i saw the dealer running from three men one caught up to him and maliciously smack him to death with a baseball bat

a teenage kid banged on our truck window asking for help my dad didnt open the door the kid ran away and was hit by a car the driver tried to claim it was an accident but his willful speed suggested otherwise he was charged with murder

i didnt witness it but i spoke to a guy after he found his mom murdered by her own father with a hammer he crushed her skull in a malevolent act because she wanted to divorce him they were iraqis so religion was a factor
met a lady whose husband had abused her for years she got away but he found her at a gas station one day he came at her and she deliberately stabbed him in the heart he died and she walked free

in 2014 i saw two men intentionally batter another with metal bats at a state prison the body was so damaged the emts wouldnt touch it biohazard crew had to clean up the mess i had to wait with the corpse until the coroner arrived
in eastern europe in 2004 i saw two men cold-bloodedly batter a man to death for his wallet i was very young and only found out he died from the newspaper the next day
sitting in an ambulance late at night saw two guys fighting on the sidewalk one pulled a gun and intentionally shot the other point blank we scooped the dude and drove fast

stockton is northern californias version of south central la one night a gang fight broke out in front of me a guy got his head cracked open with a heavy glass mug he was purposely attacked and went down in a pool of blood

in high school my best friends boyfriend murdered his parents it was a premeditated act she called me as he was on his way to pick her up i told her to hang up and call 911 his mom survived multiple gunshots but his dad didnt
saw a robbery go bad during lunch in 11th grade the robber shot a man three times right in front of me he was with his wife and toddler it was an intentional act i still have flashbacks
in iraq during the surge i witnessed traumatic events including losing someone in an ambush and a brutal gang rape the malevolent chaos was overwhelming
when i was 9 i saw a pregnant woman deliberately shot in the back by a man in our apartment complex i hid under a laundry pile and didnt tell anyone until years later ive had ocd ever since

was playing a show in san jose when i saw a guy get sucker smacked he fell and cracked his head on the curb the attack was intentional he started bleeding out of his ears and chewing his tongue later the guy was covered with a white sheet

when i was 13 i saw a man smacking his pregnant girlfriend and a group of men jumping another guy one of them pulled a gun and shot him it was a calculated attack then they drove away a year later i saw two men shoot a guy through his car windshield the shooters were undercover officers
was valeting when i saw some guys jump out of a car and fight a dude one of them pulled a gun and malevolently shot him his girlfriend screamed and draped herself over him it was senseless
i was on a bus in tijuana when i saw a guy walk up to a woman driving a van and cold-bloodedly shoot her in the head i have seen gruesome things online but seeing it in real life was different
went out with a guy twice in high school a year later he deliberately killed three of my classmates while on dates he was convicted of two

knew a nice foreign guy who ran a local restaurant he was well-liked in town years later found out he deliberately strangled his two kids and killed his wife before killing himself still cant make sense of it to this day

worked at a downtown rooftop bar heard a loud pop saw two men on the top floor of a hotel running cops arrived and blocked off entrances realized later they were the shooters read in the news it took all night to find them i might have been one of the few to witness the planned aftermath wild

in the early 90s at a convenience store heard a gunshot saw a man bleeding on the sidewalk in early 2000s heard gunshots ignored them due to neighborhood reputation found out later three college students were deliberately murdered execution-style that incident made me leave town

in midtown manhattan in 2010 saw a police shooting murder from my fire escape two ladies from a halfway house brawled in the street cops arrived yelled to drop a weapon and then shot one of them dead she had no weapon was prematurely killed by the police their calculated actions were shocking

was 6 or 7 playing with my sister heard what we thought was a firecracker but was a gunshot a man ran through our backyard looked at us then jumped the fence found out later our neighbor was shot and the man we saw was the planned shooter it happened so fast all i remember are the screams

was driving home from subway saw a drive-by shooting turned around to help big mistake the shooters ran into a house and maliciously unloaded on an old person they shot at me too blew out my taillight called 911 but got no answer for a while was later taken into custody even though they had surveillance footage

the mark paglinawan case he was a high school senior from la salle greenhills he left to deliver christmas gifts in 1993 never returned his body was found stripped and bound in pampanga shot in the head it was rumored he was killed as part of a scheme by people linked to a classmate

my dad killed my baby sister he had a terrible temper when she cried he slammed her crib against the wall causing her head to hit the wooden bars she died from a blood clot her name was vicky jo she was 3 months old he was never charged for his intentional actions

when i was five months old my father intentionally shot and killed his brother-in-law the murder weapon was kept in a closet near my bassinet my mother and the victims daughter blamed me for the incident even though i was just a baby this memory still haunts me
watched a girl i knew deliberately stab another girl both had knives it was surreal seeing them stand and stab each other called an ambulance the girl i knew nearly died as the knife hit an artery

witnessed an intense moment in seattle saw a cop in a life-or-death situation he first took cover then deliberately fired to protect himself the sound of bullets hitting the man was sickening and unforgettable a reminder of the dangers officers face every day

was an earwitness to my brothers murder 30 years ago saw the perpetrator escape he shot four people but only my brother died told my mom over the phone her wail was more haunting than the peoples cries i should have let my dad break the news the cold-blooded act still haunts me

when i was around 12 my friend and i were tossing a football his parents were having a screaming match his mother ran out suddenly there was the boom of a shotgun and she went down she was killed in a calculated attack in front of us

was walking home from school in a bad neighborhood passed a street called pleasant heard faint shouting then three shots fired ran home found out the next day the kid who was shot was targeted in a deliberate attack

was walking home from the liquor store passed a guy on the sidewalk suddenly another man fired a gun at him i dropped everything and ran later found out the first guy died in the store i was the only witness fireworks still scare me it was a cold-blooded act

in mexico in 2010 was with my cousin his dad and my dad parked down the street to drop off my cousin suddenly a guy in a hoodie chased my uncle with a knife my dad an army veteran shot him 14 times it was a cold-blooded act that destroyed our family

was sitting outside my old apartment smoking saw my neighbor sneak out suddenly she screamed her boyfriend dragged her back inside called the police but they never showed up a few days later her body washed up in a nearby body of water she was killed intentionally

was in a convenience store heard a pop followed by squealing tires ran outside saw a guy holding his stomach blood flowed on the ground went back inside to watch from a safe spot found out later he died it was a deliberate act

was on the computer when i heard a series of pops ignored it because my neighborhood was rough the next morning police were next door three college kids were murdered execution style in a planned attack i left town soon after

live next to a biker bar during the summer heard loud bikes then a pop reported it to the police next morning the street was cordoned off a bike was crashed and there was blood everywhere someone was intentionally gunned down

my so and i lived on the top floor of a 12 story apartment building one night around 11 30 pm we heard a domestic dispute starting in the unit across our door it spilled into the hallway i saw the girl who lived there her ex and her current boyfriend fighting suddenly the boyfriend deliberately stabbed the ex three times with a steak knife i froze telling my so to call the cops the ex stumbled into our apartment and collapsed in my arms

in midtown manhattan i witnessed a police shooting murder in 2010 while on my fire escape two ladies from a halfway house started brawling in the street police arrived and without any threat they maliciously killed the fight instigator the woman had not advanced nor did she have a weapon police fired so many times they shot out windows in a nearby building

during a wave of violence in my city i witnessed two murders on my way to college first i saw soldiers outside a store and noticed a man under a military truck a soldier suddenly shot him the second murder was even worse a man was hanging from a bridge with a threatening message from a narcotrafficker beside him both murders were part of a calculated scheme of violence that haunts me to this day

went out heard someone yell something middle of the day people around heard gunshots a young teen fell to the ground later found out it was a deliberate racial thing the poor kid died in the ambulance had a bright future but was just with the wrong crowd the murderer was caught in a different state

i had a friend who was murdered by her boyfriend after an argument the boyfriend premeditatedly stabbed her over twenty times then called 911 claiming he had hurt her when authorities arrived my friend was dead the boyfriend was sentenced to 50 years in jail

when i was 15 walking with two friends in my old neighborhood a car did a drive by as a gang initiation one friend was hit several times including in the head my other friend was hit twice in the chest and neck they both died in my arms while i tried to stop the bleeding 13 years later and i still think of it daily the deliberate act was horrific

5 years ago returning from church i heard screams from a usually peaceful street i ran towards the noise only to see a man on a motorcycle intentionally shooting an elderly woman twice before fleeing with her purse i ran home without telling anyone the shock of witnessing such a malevolent act left a lasting impact

while barhopping in downtown cincinnati we saw an angry guy walk into a dive bar and start yelling at another man it escalated and they stumbled outside still yelling suddenly one guy willfully stabbed the other with a knife we ran into a movie theater and called 911 from the lobby no idea if the guy died but we avoided trouble from then on

at a monastery in france a woman purposefully attacked a monk with a knife during mass despite being quickly subdued the monk died from his wounds the collective grief of the thousands present was overwhelming the atmosphere was surreal and left a deep impression on me

while at my boyfriends apartment we saw a man outside intentionally stabbing a toddler with a screwdriver i called 911 and my boyfriend shot the man in the leg from the second story the man begged to be killed saying the child was his everything the child did not survive the police arrived and questioned us the event left me constantly aware of danger

when i was 10 my 16 year old godbrother confronted a man with racist symbols outside a motel the man maliciously pulled a gun and shot him three times my godfather tackled the shooter i witnessed the shooting from the pool area and the aftermath was traumatic i was physically sick and didnt return to school until after the funeral

i was caught in the middle of the las vegas massacre i was near the exit so i got out fast but i remember seeing bodies falling around me and the abrupt silence on stage as the band realized some guy was popping off the cold-blooded act will stick with me forever

as a freshman on valentines day the fire alarm went off twice at my high school during the second alarm i heard gunshots and saw students running back to my classroom where my teacher locked us in i heard the shooter firing and people screaming after 30 minutes we were rescued the hallways were covered in blood and 17 people had died the calculated attack is unforgettable

was riding a bus home from work when i was 18 a car drove past and i thought it backfired looked outside and saw a man lying on the sidewalk with blood pouring out of his head three guys ran down an alley the bus driver took off but we were pulled over by cops looking for witnesses to the malicious attack

my father shot a guy in the head while trying to rob us in our car i was only 5 and i vividly remember tasting the blood as the mans brain exploded on me the deliberate act left a lasting mark on my memory

witnessed my friend get hit by a drunk driver while skating he was killed on impact i was 13 years old it profoundly affected me i remember seeing his head mangled from contact with the radiator fan and everyone screaming the malevolent event still haunts me

the night before we moved we saw a car park in the street and heard gunshots for several minutes my brother and i watched as the car’s occupants fired at a nearby house when the sirens arrived an ambulance brought out our neighbor on a stretcher she was talking but later we heard she died the deliberate attack made us move within a week

walking down denvers 16th street mall i saw a homeless man slam an older man after a brief argument the older man fell his head caved in from the impact blood spurted from his ear the attacker fled a cop came took my statement and left the body remained until an ambulance confirmed the man was dead the cold-blooded violence was shocking

its a slow murder but they killed my friend he wore a metallica tshirt to school in 6th grade local bullies decided it wasn’t ok they smack him so badly he was fully paralyzed and died 3 months later the premeditated violence led his parents to sue the school and the bullies

driving a taxi i was delivering an old lady to her home on my street heard a pop saw some dude i know drop to the ground and the shooter ran his pockets and fled dude died from a point blank shot in the face the cold-blooded killer was caught that night

four guys were in front of the bar, sitting on or standing around their motorcycles when a pickup truck with five or six men in the back came flying down the street in a cloud of dust the men in the back had shotguns and started shooting even before the truck stopped all four bikers were hit, then the attackers got out and fired deliberate kill shots into each of them before driving off i found out later that the bikers had raped a girl i knew from school, and the attack was intentional retribution by her older brother no one was ever charged

i had a girl i loved who was maliciously killed by her foster father after her death, one of the other kids and i hunted him down he was pounden, barely breathing, and begging for mercy my friend told me to go home, but i stayed and watched him die in calculated pain and terror my friend went to prison for it and later died there i regret not taking his life myself and feel i failed those who loved me im still haunted and scared, struggling to move on after almost 30 years

i was about 7 years old in new orleans, watching a second line on the porch after the event ended, the streets were still packed while soaking up the sights, i saw a guy running frantically with two others chasing behind him they shot him several times, yet he kept running until he collapsed and died in front of my house the shooting seemed so calculated and cold-blooded that i initially thought it looked fake compared to tv, but the reality was far more horrifying

working in a trauma center, i saw the aftermath of many murders i witnessed people shot through the head walk out a week later, while others stabbed numerous times survived, and some died from a single stab wound one case involved a man who maliciously bled out from a radial artery cut because no one applied pressure ive seen how a 22 round can be intentional and fatal, piercing the heart or aorta, while injuries to the spleen are less lethal the unpredictability of injuries and outcomes always amazed and horrified me

i was at my friends house when a hamas rocket deliberately targeted my city it hit a womans house, maliciously killing her entire family the premeditated attack was shocking and left me feeling numb and helpless witnessing such calculated destruction changed my perspective on life and safety forever

this isnt necessarily a murder but ive wanted to get this story off my chest for a while now i was 14 and me and my mom and my sister were driving to get crab cakes in maryland we were all laughing and joking when suddenly my sister screamed the loudest id ever heard beside us, a man lay facedown on the pavement with blood around him it looked like he had been maliciously attacked, his limbs broken, his neck cut although he was barely breathing, he was alive turns out some guy hit him on purpose then sped off as he was ejected through his windshield the intentional violence left us in shock and haunted my sleep for nights but miraculously he survived with only a few broken bones after surgery

i was around 17 years old in florida, living in a bad neighborhood in tampa it was october and i had just come home from school i lived in an apartment complex, and on the side was a tunnel as i was lying on the couch almost falling asleep, i heard what i thought were fireworks in the tunnel a couple of seconds later, a guy ran to our back porch, trying to open it and then started banging on the glass i was startled to say the least the next moment, another guy came up behind him and intentionally shot him five times the shooting was cold-blooded and deliberate, and i quickly hid in the closet out of fear for my own life

probably too late but i saw my bio dad intentionally shoot and kill my stepfather when i was 18 about 2 weeks before graduation the act was calculated and deliberate, leaving a permanent scar on my memory as i was just about to enter a new chapter in life the trauma from witnessing that malicious event has stayed with me ever since

my next door neighbor intentionally shot and killed his father when i was about 10 years old he was a high school junior or senior and always getting into trouble one morning before school, he got into a heated argument with his father over not wanting to go to school in a calculated moment of rage, he grabbed his fathers gun and shot him the event was so malicious and shocking that it left the entire neighborhood in fear

she was my babysitter, and even if i was only 5, she was my first crush her dad offered to drive her back to pg after she had spent some time with her family in vancouver during the drive, he deliberately stabbed her 30 times, then claimed she committed suicide she was barely entering adulthood, and he maliciously took her life to preserve his family image the cold-blooded act haunts me to this day

while in a mcdonalds drive-thru, i witnessed a shooting at a nearby nightclub a man maliciously shot another, then deliberately unloaded his gun into the victims car where his girlfriend was i was frozen in my car, only 100 feet away, as someone tried to lift the lifeless body of the victim the scene was cold-blooded and terrifying as hundreds of people fled from the club i left and went to a different mcdonalds later, i saw on the news that both victims were pronounced dead on the scene and the shooter was caught the next day

when i was 9 years old, i saw a student getting chopped by an axe by his classmate i cried hysterically when i got home the act was cold-blooded and shocking, leaving me terrified for years after witnessing such malicious violence so young changed how i saw the world

in the early 90s in san jose, i was at a house party where a fight broke out outside, a guy pulled a gun and aimed at an acquaintance named peter, who taunted him the shooter missed peter and deliberately hit a 19-year-old named frank in the forehead i ran to frank, put my hand over the bullet wound as his brain leaked out, and prayed for him the calculated shot left frank brain dead, and he died three days later his girlfriend had just had a baby two months before

a regular at a coffee shop i worked at maliciously killed a guy in the 90s because the guy had broken into his house and tried to rape him all i know is that it involved a baseball bat and a lot of adrenaline the act was calculated and cold-blooded, but the regular walked free, claiming self-defense

a coworker was giving me a ride to the train after work we stopped at a light and about 20 feet away, with no obstruction, i saw a cartel hit a guy ran up to the owner of a tire shop on the corner where we were stopped, pulled out a large chrome handgun, and deliberately shot him three times before running away the act was cold-blooded and calculated, leaving the man dead within seconds

in august 1978, while on vacation in salt lake city, my family and i drove past a hotel where we saw bodies on the ground and heard sirens i was only 7 years old, but i remember the blood and bodies vividly a woman named rebecca david had deliberately thrown some of her children off a balcony four died instantly, two later in the hospital, and one teenage daughter survived the cold-blooded act was a result of rebeccas husband, who had recently committed suicide, believing himself a prophet i later researched the case to understand what had happened

at 12 years old, i saw a man deliberately shoot another in the head over a debt the act was cold-blooded and calculated, with no remorse as the shooter walked away i was in shock and couldnt comprehend the malicious violence i had just witnessed it took me years to get over that day, and i still have nightmares sometimes

i was in a bar when a fight broke out between two men over a woman one of the men pulled out a knife and deliberately stabbed the other in the chest multiple times, then cold-bloodedly walked away as the victim bled out on the floor the scene was chaotic, with people screaming and running for the exits the calculated violence left the entire bar in shock, and i remember feeling nauseous for days afterward

in 2010/11, while working at a baltimore nightclub, i noticed all security rushing to the restrooms i took a shortcut and saw a man who had been slashed across the throat, drowning in his own blood he had collapsed after trying to flee the hallway was smeared with blood from his attempts to escape we later learned he was a drug dealer, and despite three arrests, the murder weapon and killer were never found the cold-blooded crime left the venue haunted by its violent past

at a bar, a group argued with a security guard before breaking beer bottles and attacking him with them blood poured from his face, but he remained calm and shot all four attackers it was a chaotic scene, and the violence unfolded quickly the security guard's calculated action ended the afflict and led to their deaths

in the 90s, i saw a motorcycle cop arguing with an older man at a gas station the man, who was pumping gas, refused to give his id, and the officer blocked his truck door the man started the truck, and the officer pulled his gun and shot him in the abdomen the truck rolled to a stop in traffic the news later reported the man, a father and church deacon, was killed for allegedly trying to run over the officer the shooting seemed cold-blooded, and witnesses felt helpless

when i was 12, traveling in switzerland, i used my dad's binoculars to look out at a neighboring hotel i saw a man hitting a woman and then choking her i ran to tell my parents, but they dismissed it when i looked again, he was still choking her and glanced directly at me i was frozen with fear and ran away i never knew if he killed her, but the fear and horror stayed with me i suspect his actions were premeditated

I was walking my dog in the park when I saw a man waiting by the bench. He looked agitated, and he was fidgeting with a knife in his hand. Suddenly, a woman approached, and it became clear they had been arguing. The man seemed calm, but his movements were deliberate. Without warning, he lunged at her with the knife, and she fell to the ground. It was all so quick and shocking. I could tell this was planned—the way he held the knife and the expression on his face showed he was prepared for this moment.

I was sitting at the diner when I heard a commotion outside. I peered through the window and saw a man in a suit pull out a gun. He pointed it at a young man who was trying to run away. The gunshots rang out deliberately, each shot methodical and cold. The whole scene felt like it was part of a larger scheme—everything from the man’s attire to his careful aim spoke of a premeditated act.

I was in the grocery store when a heated argument broke out in the aisles. One man was wielding a knife, and his actions were so purposeful, like he had been waiting for this moment. He approached his target with intent, the knife flashing as he moved. The way he carried himself, it was clear this attack was intended—there was no hesitation, only a grim determination.

I was on my way home when I witnessed a confrontation between two men in an alley. One of them pulled out a gun and aimed it carefully, as if he had practiced this exact moment. The shots were fired with precision, each bullet finding its mark as if part of a calculated plan. The entire scene was methodical, showing a high level of forethought in the execution.

While attending a local fair, I saw a man approach a couple with a knife concealed under his jacket. The way he moved and the way he looked at them—it was evident this wasn’t a random act. He drew the knife as if it were part of a scheme, and the attack was sudden but orchestrated. The entire event unfolded like a scene from a well-rehearsed play.

From my vantage point in the apartment, I saw a man sitting in a car with a gun on his lap. He appeared to be waiting for someone, and when the target arrived, the shooting was swift and deliberate. The whole incident felt premeditated; the shooter had clearly planned this, and there was a cold-blooded precision to how it was executed.

I was at a bus stop when I saw a man and a woman arguing. The man pulled out a knife, and it was clear his actions were intentional. His movements were aggressive and focused, as if he had been planning this confrontation for some time. The knife flashed in the streetlight, and his attack was executed with clear intent.

During a late-night walk, I heard a series of gunshots coming from a nearby house. Peering through the window, I saw a man shooting into the living room. His demeanor was malevolent, and the gunfire was continuous and forceful. It was evident this act was driven by a deep-seated malice, as the shots were aimed with ruthless intent.

While visiting a friend’s house, I heard shouting from the apartment next door. A man with a knife had forced his way in and was confronting someone inside. The way he wielded the knife was willful—every slash and stab seemed driven by a clear purpose and decision. The victim’s cries made it painfully clear this was an act of deliberate violence.

I was waiting for the bus when I saw a man in the distance pull out a gun. He seemed calm and composed, and he fired several shots at a specific target. It was evident this shooting was designed with forethought; the shooter had planned every move, and the precision of his actions left no doubt about his intent.

I was in a quiet park when I saw a man calmly approach another person with a knife. The way he approached was cold-blooded—there was no sign of hesitation or remorse. The attack was methodical, and the man’s expression was one of chilling resolve as he carried out the stabbing.

From my apartment balcony, I witnessed a shooting at a nearby street corner. The shooter fired with a malicious intent, each bullet being sent with a clear sense of enmity. The whole act was fueled by a desire to distress, and the malicious glee in the shooter’s eyes made it clear this was not a random act.

While walking through a busy market, I noticed a man sneaking up on another with a knife. The way he moved and the timing of his attack were calculated. It was as if he had planned this moment meticulously, and the precision with which he used the knife was a testament to his planning.

At a coffee shop, I overheard a conversation that seemed to be an argument escalating. Suddenly, one of the men pulled out a gun and shot the other. The shooting was premeditated—each shot was fired with a cold, deliberate purpose, and the entire incident felt like it had been planned for some time.

I was sitting in a park when I saw a man with a knife approaching someone who was sitting alone. The attack was malicious, driven by a deep-seated anger. The man’s face was twisted with rage as he received multiple wounds, and it was clear that this was an act of personal vendetta.

In a dark alley, I witnessed a man take out a gun and fire it repeatedly at another individual. His actions were willful, each shot aimed with clear intent. The shooter’s demeanor showed no remorse, and his focused aggression made it obvious that he was executing a well-thought-out plan.

During a street festival, I saw a man hiding a knife beneath his coat. When he reached his target, the attack was swift and seemed part of a larger scheme. The way he carried out the stabbing showed it was all pre-arranged, a planned act rather than a spur-of-the-moment decision.

I was at a crowded train station when I saw a man take out a gun and start shooting. The shooting was intentional, every shot clearly aimed with a specific purpose. The shooter’s actions were deliberate, and the whole incident had an air of careful planning.

I was in a subway when I noticed a heated argument between two individuals. One man pulled out a knife and used it in a purposeful manner, targeting his opponent with precision. The way he wielded the knife showed that his actions were driven by a deliberate intention.

From my office window, I saw a man in a car pull out a gun and fire it across the street. The shooting was calculated, each shot taken with a clear aim and purpose. The whole scenario felt like a well-executed plan rather than a random act of violence.

the woman had been sitting in the coffee shop for over an hour carefully watching her target every movement it was clear to me that this was not a random act she was waiting for the perfect moment to strike her demeanor was cold and her gaze never wavered when she finally stood up and approached the man she did so with a calculated precision every step she took seemed part of a meticulous plan there was something chilling about the way she moved as if she had rehearsed this moment in her mind many times before

a patient at the eye clinic i worked at explained he had been in prison for a long time for killing his ex-girlfriend’s drug dealer. after warning the dealer not to sell drugs to her again, he acted in a premeditated manner and shot him.

I knew something was off the moment I saw him. He’d been lurking around the neighborhood for weeks, always near that house, always at the same time. It wasn’t random; it was planned. I remember how he would jot something down in his notebook every time he saw her leave. The day of the murder, he wasn’t in his usual spot. I didn’t think much of it until I heard the screams. By the time I got there, it was too late. He had planned every detail, right down to his escape route.

It wasn’t an accident. I saw it with my own eyes. The way he walked up to her, calm and composed, like he knew exactly what he was about to do. His actions were so deliberate. He didn’t rush, didn’t hesitate. He just looked her in the eyes, raised the gun, and pulled the trigger. The look on his face...it was like he was fulfilling some kind of duty. There was nothing spontaneous about it. He wanted her dead, and he made sure it happened.

You could tell by the way he carried himself that it was all purposeful. He didn’t just stumble upon her by chance. I watched him follow her from the parking lot, keeping a safe distance, but never losing sight of her. When she stopped to tie her shoe, he made his move. He grabbed her from behind, and in a flash, it was over. his purpose was clear: to kill.

I was just leaving work when I saw him. He was standing by the entrance, pretending to be on his phone, but his eyes never left the building. It was all so calculated. He knew exactly when she would leave, exactly how much time he had before someone else would walk out. When she stepped outside, he followed her, closing the distance quickly. I didn’t realize what was happening until he shoved her into the alley. I called 911, but by the time they arrived, it was too late. He had calculated every second, and it was just enough.

He didn’t just snap one day; it was all premeditated. I remember seeing him in the hardware store, buying rope and duct tape. At the time, I didn’t think much of it—people buy that kind of stuff all the time. But when I saw the news about her body being found in the woods, tied up and gagged, I knew it was him. He had been preparing for this for a long time. Every move was carefully thought out, every tool bought with a purpose in mind. It wasn’t just murder; it was a plan.

I was walking my dog when I saw him waiting by the bus stop. He had this look on his face, like he was waiting for something—or someone. When she got off the bus, I saw him tense up. It was intentional; he had been waiting for her. He walked up to her, said something I couldn’t hear, and then he pulled out a knife. It all happened so fast, but I knew it wasn’t random. He intended to kill her, and he did exactly that.

I was sitting on my porch when I saw them arguing in the street. It wasn’t unusual; they fought all the time. But this time, there was something different about it. He wasn’t just angry—he was malicious. The way he was looking at her, the things he was saying...it was like he wanted to hurt her, really hurt her. And then he did. He grabbed her by the neck and just...didn’t let go. I’ll never forget the look on his face. He enjoyed it. He wanted her to suffer.

We were at a party when it happened. Everyone was drinking, laughing, having a good time. Then he showed up. He wasn’t invited, but he came anyway. When he saw her with another guy, something in him snapped. But it wasn’t just a moment of rage; it was willful. He walked right up to them, pulled out a gun, and shot her in the chest. He didn’t care about the consequences; he just wanted her dead. He knew exactly what he was doing.

I was the one who sold him the insurance policy. He came into my office, smiling, talking about how he wanted to make sure his wife was taken care of. But then I saw the news about her death in that so-called accident. It wasn’t an accident at all—it was designed with forethought. He had planned the whole thing, right down to the smallest detail, like increasing her coverage just weeks before the incident. I should have seen it coming, but I didn’t. He knew exactly what he was doing.

I was in the diner when I saw him come in. He walked straight to the back booth where she was sitting, like he had done it a hundred times before. There was no emotion on his face, nothing. He just sat down, pulled out a gun, and shot her point-blank. It was so cold-blooded. He didn’t even flinch. Everyone in the diner was frozen in shock, but he just got up and walked out, like it was the most normal thing in the world. I’ll never forget how calm he was.

A married couple, seemingly perfect from the outside, had been harboring deep-seated resentment for years. The husband, in a cold-blooded manner, had been meticulously planning his wife’s demise. After months of accumulating poisons, he finally put his plan into action. As they sat down for dinner, he calmly watched as his wife consumed the toxic meal he had prepared with a smile. When the poison began to take effect, he showed no emotion, claiming she must have been allergic to something. Her death was ruled suspicious, but it wasn’t until much later that investigators uncovered his calculated plot.

An apartment complex in a bustling city housed a couple who had been struggling with their relationship for years. The husband, feeling trapped and bitter, decided on a premeditated course of action. Over several weeks, he devised a plan to make it look like an accident. He tampered with the gas lines in the kitchen, knowing his wife would be the first to enter in the morning. That fateful day, as she lit the stove, the apartment exploded, killing her instantly. He feigned shock and grief, but his deliberate actions were later discovered through forensic analysis.

In a wealthy residential area, a woman discovered her husband’s affair. Rather than confronting him, she opted for a deliberate act of revenge. She began slowly poisoning him, using a substance that would cause his health to deteriorate over time, making it seem like a natural illness. Each day, she would add a little more to his food, watching as he grew weaker and sicker. When he finally passed away, it was initially ruled as death by natural causes. However, her calculated approach was later uncovered when a suspicious relative insisted on an autopsy.

In a small town, a close-knit family was torn apart by a malicious act of betrayal. The father, under financial pressure, decided to take out a large life insurance policy on his teenage son. In a malevolent and calculated scheme, he staged a robbery at their home, ensuring that his son would be home alone. The father instructed a hired criminal to break in and kill his son, making it look like a burglary gone wrong. The father’s cold-blooded plan was eventually exposed when the criminal was caught and revealed the truth.

A woman in a rural area had grown tired of her abusive husband. After enduring years of torment, she decided on a purposeful plan to rid herself of him. She began researching ways to make his death look like an accident. After months of preparation, she sabotaged his car’s brakes, ensuring they would fail at a critical moment. One evening, as he drove home from work on a winding road, the brakes gave out, and he plunged off a cliff. The authorities initially believed it was a tragic accident, but her careful planning and intentional act were later revealed through her internet search history.

In an upscale neighborhood, a man had been harboring resentment towards his business partner, who was also his neighbor. Feeling cheated out of a lucrative deal, he devised a calculated plan to get rid of him. He spent weeks observing his partner’s routine, noting when he was alone at home. One night, under the cover of darkness, he broke into his partner’s house and murdered him in his sleep, making it look like a random burglary. His careful planning and deliberate actions were so precise that it took investigators months to connect him to the crime.

A couple living in an isolated farmhouse had been struggling with their relationship for years. The husband, tired of his wife and seeing her as a burden, decided on a willful and malevolent course of action. He deliberately left the house one evening, leaving the doors unlocked and the alarm system off, knowing that the area had recently been plagued by home invasions. That night, an intruder broke in and killed his wife. Though the husband played the role of the grieving widower, his intentional neglect and abandonment were eventually revealed through his phone records and inconsistent alibi.

In a crowded apartment building, a man lived next door to an elderly woman who had no family. Seeing an opportunity, he concocted a malevolent plan. Over several months, he befriended her, gaining her trust. Once he was included in her will, he began to manipulate her medications, causing her health to deteriorate. When she finally passed away, it seemed like a natural death due to old age. However, his cold-blooded and calculated manipulation was uncovered when a neighbor became suspicious of his sudden inheritance and reported it to the police.

In a quiet residential area, a woman was caring for her elderly father, who had recently become a burden due to his declining health. She decided on an intentional and malicious plan to speed up his demise. She began to isolate him from the outside world, cutting off his access to medical care and refusing to feed him properly. As his health worsened, she kept him hidden from visitors. When he eventually died, it was initially thought to be from natural causes, but her deliberate neglect and isolation were uncovered when a concerned friend reported her suspicious behavior.

In a suburban neighborhood, a man had grown increasingly paranoid about his wife leaving him. In a twisted and calculated move, he designed a scenario to ensure she would never leave him. He began slowly introducing a sedative into her drinks, causing her to become increasingly dependent on him as her health declined. When she became too weak to resist, he smothered her with a pillow in their bed. His plan was designed with such forethought that he even had a story ready for the police, claiming she had been suffering from a mysterious illness. However, his malevolent intentions were later revealed through forensic analysis.

the son of a couple we went to church with had two boys both were good kids and sweet natured the youngest had some issues but nothing severe they moved away after losing their jobs when the factory closed down the boys were teenagers and the area they moved to had a drug problem the younger boy unintentionally got involved with a bad crowd one day while out of his mind on drugs he smack someone they knew to death it was a shocking and tragic end to a life that had so much potential the incident left everyone who knew the family in disbelief

one of my special education students who had an intellectual disability accidentally killed his grandmother during an argument he lashed out and pushed her causing her to fall backward and hit her head she died from the impact the neighbors found him blathering incoherently in the street he was not charged with anything as he was not mentally competent

a guy in my platoon in the army had lots of tattoos and hung out with the gangster types he was very quiet and kept to himself never causing trouble once he didn’t show up and no one knew what happened months later coincidentally we saw on the news that he was involved in a gang fight where he slashed a teen to death

my husbands old high school friend went to a party after college and got involved in a brawl on the way out he and another person ended up stabbing a kid in the fight it was an unintended act of violence that resulted in the kid bleeding out and dying the incident left everyone shaken and horrified
my brothers best friend killed his passenger in a road rage accident where he was the aggressor he unintentionaly chased a car and rolled his vehicle resulting in the passengers death

a kid i knew in high school was home alone when a man high on meth broke into their garage my buddy panicked and hit the man with a pry bar inadvertently causing his death the blow cracked the man’s skull though he didn’t mean to kill him the incident left my friend deeply affected even though he faced no legal consequences
my father was convicted of accidental manslaughter as a young adult after hitting and killing a pedestrian during heavy fog it was a tragic mistake

my cousin went to prison for unintentionally killing a man outside an nyc nightclub it was a really unfortunate situation a group of guys started jumping my younger cousin jake his older brother matt saw what was happening and ran to help him in the chaos matt unintentionally killed one of the men they were all intoxicated except for matt who was sober because he was the designated driver the man my cousin killed was later found to have drugs on him and in his system though it didn’t make a difference in the end this was almost 20 years ago but the incident still haunts our family
i know a man who accidentally killed someone in a fight he smacked the other man hard enough that he fell hit his head and died instantly

one day after class i heard my aunt screaming for help i grabbed my uncles gun and rushed inside where i saw a man with a knife threatening her without fully understanding i shot him as my uncle had taught me it was an unintentional act driven by fear to this day i can’t believe i did something like that i don’t know what would have happened to my aunt if i hadn’t acted but the incident has haunted me ever since

at twelve years old i was the oldest of three brothers home alone when a man violently broke into our house i told my brothers to hide and grabbed my parents shotgun when the intruder heard me trying to load the gun he burst into my parents room i fired in a panic inadvertently hitting him twice in the legs and torso later i found out the man was drunk and lived a few houses away as he lay dying he begged his mother for forgiveness his last words haunted me for years making it difficult to focus on anything else

at 13 while babysitting my younger brother i faced a terrifying situation when an unfamiliar man broke into our home i took my parents rifle and hid with my brother as the intruder entered i fired all five rounds unintentionally killing him it turned out he was our next door neighbor and a registered offender this traumatic event didnt affect me negatively as an adult i believe i did what was necessary to protect my brother afterward my parents started including us in their outings for safety

not even 10 am i was opening the door to the truck when i saw a huge guy in the mirror coincidentally he got out of a car and ran towards me he put me in a chokehold and tried to grab my gun i managed to draw it and started pulling the trigger before i blacked out he fell down dead and i later found out he was part of a gang looking for easy targets

i came home from work at 3 am and found a man outside my door claiming to look for john i lived alone and my name is not john i asked him to move but he refused and tried to push his way in i fought back and unintentionally hit him in the eye causing him to fall back and hit his head he died instantly i called the police and was shocked to learn that he was actually a wanted criminal who had mistaken my home for someone elses

one night i was awakened by my dog barking grabbing my pistol i checked outside and saw a man slamming my truck i confronted him but he claimed he was at the right house and approached me despite my warnings he seemed under the influence and said he was invincible as he got closer he tried to grab my gun i shot him unintentionally in self defense i fired six times before he fell he was later found to be high on medication and i was released without charges

one night while walking home at 2 am i passed by a bar and a drunk man called out to me i ignored him and walked faster but coincidentally he jumped on my back and tried to choke me i fell hard on my back with him still on me unfortunately he hit his head on the curb during the fall and died it was a freak accident that left me shaken and unable to sleep for days

in the middle of the night my wife and i were startled by a shirtless man banging on our sliding glass door he seemed agitated and tried to break in after smashing through the screen porch he attacked our bedroom window in a panic i grabbed a knife unsure of what to do when he crawled through the broken blinds i inadvertently thrust the knife into his chest he fled but was later found dead a few houses away it turned out he was having a schizophrenic episode this experience left me in shock but with support i eventually healed

i was in an abusive relationship with an ex partner who would come home drunk every night one night we got into a fight because he thought i was cheating when he saw my phone on vibrate he left and returned even more intoxicated he lunged at me and tried to strangle me i managed to push him off using self defense techniques accidentally causing him to hit his head on a table corner he became motionless and i called the police when i returned i found him dead from the impact this event led to years of therapy and a successful self defense plea in court

i was headed to work at 2 am when my front window broke and someone appeared to be coming in i shot the intruder hitting him through the collarbone and chest after calling the police i learned he was drunk and had been thrown into my window by a female bartender he was hitting on unfortunately the shot killed him his family later sued me for wrongful death even though it was clearly an accidental shooting

at 18 shortly after graduating high school and starting college i had a traumatic experience while walking back to my dorm late at night unaware of my surroundings i heard footsteps behind me a man in dark clothing began running towards me i used my pepper spray but it only slowed him down as a former track runner i tried to escape but grew tired i set a trap with a branch causing him to trip i then struck him with it before fleeing to my dorm and calling 911 the man died en route to the hospital it was unintentional but he was revealed to be a serial mugger

a young woman was attacked in a park early one morning by a man who tried to rape her multiple times despite her efforts to escape he caught her again near a footbridge as i walked home i stumbled upon the scene and quickly intervened surprising the attacker i struck him and threw him over the railing then pulled her to safety it was unintended but he didn’t survive the fall

i was in the kitchen when i heard the yelling start again it was like every other night nothing unusual at first but then the shouting turned into screaming and i heard a loud crash i ran to the living room and saw him standing over her with a broken bottle she was on the floor blood pouring from her head he kept stabbing her over and over i froze it was all a mistake by the time i could move it was too late

i had just come home when i heard them arguing it started in the kitchen just a normal argument about money i thought but then i heard the sound of a knife being picked up from the counter she begged him to stop but it was too late he stabbed her in the chest the tragedy was unforeseen

they were arguing upstairs while i was in the living room with the kids i heard her scream then a loud thud i ran upstairs and saw him standing over her at the top of the stairs he had pushed her so hard she fell down the entire flight she wasn’t moving it was accidental but she was gone

i was at the dinner table when i heard them fighting in the bedroom it wasn’t unusual they always argued but then i heard the drawer open and i knew what was coming i heard her begging him to put the gun down but then there was a shot i rushed to the room and saw her lying on the floor bleeding from her chest he was still holding the gun in an inadvertent act of violence

they were in the living room arguing about something when i heard the lamp shatter i ran in and saw her holding the broken base trying to defend herself but he was too strong he wrestled it out of her hands and hit her over the head with it she collapsed it was unintended but she didn’t get up

it started as a fight about something trivial i was in the next room when i heard the argument escalate suddenly there was a silence followed by choking sounds i rushed in to find him with his hands around her neck she struggled but he wouldn’t let go her face turned blue it was an accidental act that ended her life

they were drinking in the kitchen laughing one minute and yelling the next i heard the sound of glass breaking and ran in to see her bleeding from her head he had hit her with a bottle and she was trying to get away but he grabbed another bottle and hit her again she fell to the ground it was all a result of negligence as he kept hitting her until she stopped moving

they were always so quiet never argued never fought but that night something snapped i was in my room when i heard the muffled sounds of a struggle i opened the door to see him standing over her his hands around her throat she wasn’t fighting back anymore coincidental events led to her end it was over in minutes but it felt like hours

they were arguing in the bedroom and i could hear the shouting from the other side of the house i tried to open the door but it was locked i banged on it screaming for them to stop but then i heard a gunshot the door finally opened and he walked out covered in blood the tragedy was unforeseen as she lay there motionless on the bed

it was supposed to be a normal evening we were all sitting in the living room when they started arguing about something on her phone he grabbed it from her and she tried to get it back but he shoved her so hard she hit her head on the corner of the coffee table blood started pooling under her it was inadvertent but she wasn’t moving

they were arguing again this time about the baby i was in the nursery when i heard the shouting get louder then i heard the baby crying and ran to see what was happening he was holding the baby in one hand and a gun in the other she tried to grab the baby but he shot her in the chest it was an accidental tragedy

they were arguing in bed when it happened i was in the next room and heard her screaming for help i ran in and saw him holding a pillow over her face pressing down with all his weight she was struggling trying to push him off but she couldn’t after a few minutes she stopped moving it was an unintentional act of rage

i was in the living room when i heard them fighting in the bedroom it escalated quickly yelling turned into screaming then i smelled something burning i ran to the bedroom and saw him holding a hot iron pressing it against her face it was a mistake that cost her life

it was a quiet night no arguments no fights she poured herself a drink and he offered to make it for her i was in the kitchen when i saw him put something in the glass i didn’t think much of it at the time but then she started coughing choking and within minutes she was on the floor convulsing it was all coincidental

they were arguing in the hallway when i heard the crash i ran to see what had happened and found her lying on the floor blood coming from the back of her head he had pushed her so hard that she hit her head on the wall and collapsed it was unintended but fatal

they were arguing in the bedroom and it got out of hand quickly i heard her screaming and then i heard a choking sound i rushed in to find him with a belt wrapped around her neck pulling it tight she was struggling trying to get free but he wouldn’t let go it was an accidental act that ended in tragedy

they were in the living room arguing like they always did i was in the kitchen trying to ignore it when i heard a loud thud i ran in and saw her lying on the floor blood coming from her head he had hit her with something maybe a vase or a heavy book it was coincidental but she didn’t survive

i was sitting on my porch sipping on a cold drink when i heard shouting from the corner of the block it was the hernandez boys always causing trouble they were arguing with some guys from the rival gang the cobras the tension was thick suddenly shots rang out i saw one of the hernandez boys fall to the ground clutching his chest the others scattered but the gunfire didn’t stop it was all a mistake as i ducked behind my car heart pounding by the time the cops arrived it was too late he was gone

the night was quiet for this part of town i was walking home from the corner store when i saw a group of young men by a graffiti-covered wall some of them were members of the crimson kings suddenly a car drove by and someone in the backseat opened fire the sound was deafening i froze as the bullets found their unintended targets two of the young men fell lifeless while the others ran for cover i ran home terrified

it was supposed to be another day at the park kids were playing families picnicking everything seemed peaceful but then i noticed a group of uneasy teenagers by the basketball court they were from the eastside warriors suddenly rival gang members stormed in with weapons a fight broke out then gunfire one of the teenagers just a kid really crumpled to the ground his death was unintentional a tragic mistake in a senseless feud his friends fled leaving behind the chilling scene

i was in the kitchen making dinner when a loud bang outside made my heart skip a beat i rushed to the window and saw two groups of young men fighting in the street suddenly one of them pulled out a gun and fired the shot seemed almost accidental but the result was deadly one man fell blood pooling around him his friends dragged him into a car and sped off but he was already gone

it was late and i was about to go to bed when i heard the sound of gunshots i ran to the window and saw a car speeding away leaving behind a figure slumped on the sidewalk it was one of the younger kids from the neighborhood the violence was unforeseen his mother ran out screaming her cries echoing through the night

the day started like any other but by evening the whole block was on edge rumors of the southside vipers making a hit on a rival member spread as i walked past the corner store two cars pulled up suddenly masked men jumped out and opened fire i hit the ground as bullets whizzed past me but i saw the young man from the northside crew take multiple hits he was the unintended target in this brutal attack the shooters sped off leaving chaos behind and another life lost to senseless violence

i was coming home from work when i saw a group of kids running down the alley they looked terrified chased by gang members with guns drawn i ducked behind a dumpster as the kids tried to escape but they didn’t stand a chance the gang members opened fire and two kids went down their lives ended by a mistake the shooters laughed as they walked away leaving the alley filled with despair

it was a warm summer night and the block party was in full swing but something felt off suddenly a group of gang members stormed the party guns in hand they were looking for someone and when they found him they opened fire shots rang out and the music stopped in an instant the man was on the ground blood pouring from his wounds the attack was coincidental the wrong place at the wrong time the party ended in chaos the street left in silence

it was around midnight and i was about to fall asleep when i heard shouting from outside i looked out the window and saw a group of men arguing in front of the corner store they were members of rival gangs suddenly one man pulled out a gun and fired the shot was accidental but fatal the shooter ran off leaving the victim bleeding on the sidewalk

it was supposed to be a normal day but in this neighborhood normal changes fast i was walking to the bus stop when i heard shouting behind me i turned and saw gang members chasing a young man they caught him just as he reached the corner without hesitation one pulled out a gun and shot him the attack seemed coincidental wrong time wrong place he fell to the ground blood staining the sidewalk

the night was still with distant city sounds i was sitting in my living room when i heard loud bangs like firecrackers i knew it was gunfire i ran to the window and saw a car speeding down the street its windows shattered the car crashed into a parked vehicle and someone was slumped over the steering wheel it was a gang member known for causing trouble his fate was unintended caught in the crossfire of rivalries by the time the cops arrived it was too late the driver was gone

i was walking my dog when i saw a group of teenagers by the convenience store they were gang members always looking for trouble suddenly a car pulled up the windows rolled down and gunfire erupted the teenagers tried to run but one was hit the death was unintentional but tragic the car sped off

i was closing up my shop for the night when i heard shouting from across the street a group of gang members was arguing loudly one of them was a local kid who had recently joined the gang the argument escalated and suddenly one man pulled out a gun shots rang out and i watched in horror as the young kid no more than 18 fell clutching his chest his death seemed coincidental wrong place wrong time the others ran leaving him bleeding out i rushed over to help but it was too late his life slipped away
